Definition: Sir Alex Ferguson. The Sting (qv) of football management
Example Use: I'll piss my pants if Glazer gives old Beetroot Face his marching orders.

Definition: Taking a colossal dump, of such proportions that both vision and hearing are periodically, if momentarily, obliterated, rendering the proper" enjoyment of music impossible."
Example Use: I spend all morning unpacking so I've no idea what Damon Allbran's latest Tunisian Nose Flute album sounds like. I'll tell you one thing though, I'm never eating mince vindaloo tartare again!

Definition: A (shortened) derogatory label given to an idea of little value; a person of little import; a gadget (see iRiver) with no real value to anyone. See also chocolate fireguard, ashtray on a motorbike etc.
Example Use: See that iRiver, it's about as much use as a Sponge Leg in the Rain

Definition: Visual representations of attractive burds.
Example Use: Any pics?

Definition: Superlative of talentless.
Example Use: I am talentless. You are more talentless. He is Mike Read.

Definition: 1. Arboreal creature that's fond of bananas. 2. Dangerous Frenchy spy who's over here in secret working to ban Fish and Chips and the pound.
Example Use: There's one! Right Pierre, it's the rack for you and if you don't squeal you'll be hanging from the yard-arm before sun-down.

Definition: Unusual adjective used to describe the quality of music with variable meaning depending on the describer. For Scott, superb means any album he's just bought however bad it may be. For John G, superb means superb in the traditional sense. To most of the List, superb means OK but to Andy it means utter rubbish.
Example Use: Those Bylorussian throat warbellers (qv) were superb.

Definition: TOON (qv) for racist coffee drinkers with no profanity filters to worry about.
Example Use: Watched that Richard Pryor video last night over a cup of mocha. Classic COON stuff.

Definition: A record of an event. Usually referring to a festival or a trip abroad. Normally tedious beyond belief and consisting of breathlessly banal stuff like in taxi
Originator: on way to airport" or  "about to order another pint" or "namaste" (qv)."
Example Use: Leigh
column5: Gil's Glasto blog was really top notch. Not the usual guff at all. Wonder where he stole it from.

Definition: A bizarre formation of female persons arranged around John Bailey. Resembling an attempt to beat the number of people on a motor-bike probably shown on Blue Peter or Record Breakers in the 70s.
Example Use: Did anyone get a photo of John Bailey and his motor-cycle display team

Definition: A painful condition characterised by the offering of overly long and tedious justifications of how blunders of Fat Larry (qv) proportions actually weren't
Example Use: Ramsay's justification that a pitta bread stuffed with falafel could also be referred to as a falafel was nothing more than another case of Fat Larry Syndrome.

Definition: 1. Beer out of Nose; a more acceptable form of COON (qv) for the itinerant PM with no place to call home, and who is therefore reduced to sitting in bars pretending to work. 2) A Manc lad with a dodgy haircut who was cool as f*ck"
Originator: played the organ and fired a non-entity called Noel Gallagher from his band."
Example Use: Andy
column5: BOON !  I nearly spilt Guinness on my project plan then...

Definition: Rare bird. Only chick to penetrate the closed and secretive order of the MusicList. Her mysterious disappearance still occasions comment.
Example Use: Shame Loobs isn't here to comment on this one.

Definition: Standing. Not Sitting. And thinking of same as a good idea.
Anything related to Oireland. See also 'craic'.
Example Use: I hate that Mike Scott, and his music, and his fake Oirishness

Definition: Institute of Journeymen (qv)
Example Use: PM 1: "Couldn't be ersed doing a status report this week so I just re-sent last weeks." PM 2: "Sheer class. Proper IoJ stuff."

Definition: Young porcine mammal commonly held under the arm of slack-jawed, cross-eyed, jug-eared witless peasants about to participate in a spot of the craic (qv). A modern variation involves squeezing five pounds of pork sausage into your jacket pocket and getting ejected from pubs with extreme vengeance by junior bar staff with elephant-like memories.

Indicative of an unfunny 'joke'. Originates from a tedious anecdote by Peter Cook confusing 'secateurs' with 'sequitous' or something equally forced. Became the benchmark for unfunniness when passed on by - who else - Ramsay. A new low (qv) in 'comedy'
Example Use: God knows. It was too boring to remember it. Someone can search out the message.

Definition: 1. Interminable twittering music where each song lasts no less than 15 minutes and seems like 15 hours. Usually played by gay people with goatees, and small sun-glasses smoking cheroots or old, deformed, dead black guys from the Deep South, Always utter rubbish.  2. Superb (qv) stuff.
Example Use: Causing Andy's sister untold amusement,

Definition: A long since forgotten tradition of recounting the subjects discussed on the list, yet regurgitated in a humourous, nay critical, way.  Despised by everyone including Marty and discontinued.
Example Use: Whatever happened to the Monthly Review?

Definition: A Nobo wannabe (see Nobo)
Example Use: Do you think Chris Martin would want to save dolphins if one bit his face off?

Definition: Revolutionary software trickery that lets tight-fisted users wear a stupid headset and talk to little men inside their computer over the telephone network.
Example Use: Andy felt secretly miffed that he was the only kid on the block without a skype.

Definition: The superlative of 'pretentious'. Just as we have good, better, best, so we also have pretentious, more pretentious and 'Ramsay in Paris'. One might use this phrase when describing, for example, the writings of Michel Houellebecq. Or possibly Scott's attendance at some daft world music concert.
Example Use: Gil's championing of Miles Davis was real Ramsay In Paris stuff.

Definition: Tea Out Of Nose (abbrev). A spontaneous and hysterical reaction to an unusually funny post (i.e. unlikely to be one of Andy's).
Example Use: Leigh's suggestion that Everton might make the knock-out stages of the Champions Leage provided a welcome TOON moment

Definition: A type of sandwich. Definitely not a fried snack made from chickpeas. And to suggest so would be culinary dilettantism at its worst.
A collection of CDs which will never be played again. Approximately 99% of all CDs ever bought end up here.
Example Use: How long do we give the new Lucinda Williams CD before it ends up in everyone's pile.

Definition: To be accused of a fondness for dismal lo-fi 'Americana'
Example Use: I've never listened to the Cowboy Junkies in my life and strongly resent being tarred with the Ramsay brush!

Definition: Middle-class culinery equivalent of "sour grapes". Original meaning relates to a continued insistence that a foodstuff that one is innately  incapable of cooking is actually inedible.  Can also be applied to more general life situations.
Example Use: No one could decide whether Marty's claim that ballroom dancing was gay was a genuine sentiment or simply a case of cardboard tuna.

Definition: LibDem or SNP
Example Use: You can either vote for a Tory Party (Labour or Conservative), a fearty party or a proper socialist party - the SSP.

Definition: Ramsay List Persona (abbrev). A proposer of ideas so fanciful and pretentious that they couldn't possibly be true. Could they? Also knows more about footy than anyone else on ML.
Example Use: No. I actually DO put chocolates on the pillows in the guest bedroom when I have friends staying. This isn't RLP talking.

Definition: John Griffiths
Example Use: Where the heck is Taff ? We hardly see him these days. I guess he's waiting for us to talk about music again

Definition: dismal lo-fi 'Americana'
Example Use: can we go somewhere where they're not playing Ramsay Music?.

Definition: Posting Of The Week. A contribution which is so funny that the list has a collective TOON (qv) moment. Awarded randomly by anyone who sees fit. It is technically not impossible to have several POTWs in a given week. In practice, POTWs happen only rarely
Example Use: POTW. LOL.

Definition: Female equivalent of bowling from the Pavilion End (qv).Also 'Sensible Shoes'.
Example Use: I'm sure that Kirsty Wark favours a comfortable shoe
column5: but she seemed to be giving that laddie out of the Libertines the glad eye..."."

Definition: Describing a very obvious and widely held opinion that Andy disagrees with, or fails to understand. Or, commonly, both. Not to be confused with 'Ach' as in Ach
Example Use: Andy
column5: Boab's suggestion that bears were liable to sh!tting in the woods was surely arch.

Definition: Un-manly or generally unpleasant and repulsive. Gay things include white headphones, Andy's phone and Jonny Wilkinson. Interestingly bowling from the pavilion end isn't necessarily gay in the list sense.
Example Use: You're gay. No I'm not, you are and so is your Dad.....etc...

Definition: A distinguished mentor to the group with a justifiably patrician attitude to life and a vicelike grip on the leading edge.
Example Use: I'm stumped - let's see what Unk thinks...

Definition: Some way off in the distance. Nearly out of sight.
Example Use: Not that old Snow Patrol/Keane debate (soi disant) again...

Definition: the utterly trivial, analysed and deconstructed until all present are comatose or psychotic. Example: the La's 'debate' (soi disant).
Example Use: these apostrophal threads are of no interest to anyone and threaten to undermine the mighty edifice of the List.

Definition: Posting Of The Month. An ill-defined accolade for a posting which exceeds the TOON benchmark of funniness and causes listmembers to die
Example Use: POTM ! (exeunt omni, dying)

Definition: A diversionary tactic, unlike Jon's blatant answering a question with a question technique
Example Use: Look Goldfish!

Definition: 1.One of the greatest records ever made. 2.Guillotining device bringing to a close threads, or discussions, deemed too recondite to sustain common interest. See also STFU, FFS shut up etc.
Example Use: Psychocandy.

Definition: Non-existent situation comedy invented by Ramsay so he'd seem clever. Dismal arch (qv) humour seldom rises above secateurs (qv) level.
Example Use: See Curb last night? TOON stuff. "Yeah. Sure."

Definition: 1. The indefinite article. 2. An ironic term put in front of another word to feign a complete lack of knowledge of something. In fact, of course, it displays a powerful grasp of the subject for those in the know. Sometimes written as 'your' or 'my'
Example Use: An internet. Your Skype. His Yahoo Messenger.

Definition: See Comfortable shoes.
Example Use: New Glaswegian burd at work - wears suits and cuff links - so clearly a tennis player...

Definition: 1. Ginger journeyman (qv) footballing twat. 2. Creative ball passing genius (RLP use only).
Example Use: I think them loyalist boys had the right idea with their Neil Lennon letter writing campaign.

Definition: Geeky musical device. It contains a leprechaun that sends out magical rays to the car radio that makes it play non-stop Country and Western (qv). Also OldManRiver, iPlod, whatever weird thing Marty's got etc.
Example Use: Well Mohammed, I've got 374 Country and Western tracks on this. Tell me where bin Laden's hiding or I press play.

Definition: Posting De La Semaine.  Un contribution qu'est tant humoureux que la liste a un moment TOON (qv) collectif.
Example Use: PDLS. ME (qv).

Definition: Self-conscious expression of spontaneous joy, favoured by slack-jawed, cross-eyed, jug-eared witless peasants all over Oireland (qv), but now, regrettably, spreading to the mainland. To be used only in an ironic sense (if at all) by persons of learning and discernment.
Example Use: Will ye be going to the pub Froiday ? Oi hear the craic will be noinety over a hoondred
column5: hee hee hee".  Alternative: "I say Jeremy
column6: how was the 'craic' at rugger last night?"."

Definition: Delivering a severe and physical admonishment administered by one's spouse or partner after a night Out With Andy (qv).
Originator: (The legendary) Robert Taylor who was actually Le Creuseted with a Le Creuset.
Example Use: (Andy) Lorraine's going to Le Creuset me when I get in. I said I'd be back three days ago.

Definition: Marty. Fallen into disuse recently. Deserves to be reinstated.
Example Use: Even the Hapless Goth has been to more list nights out than Leigh. And he's been in Canada for years.

Definition: Unacceptable, even by List Standards. Origin unknown. Thought to be one of: (a) Corruption of Beyond The Pail" meaning going downhill even faster than the bucket in the Jack & Jill nursery rhyme; (b) Describing an illness with more severe symptoms than merely being off-colour; (c) Tasting even worse than fizzy keg Pale Ale"
Example Use: Another tedious etymology lesson must surely be beyond the pale, even for Boab.

Term: Pike in a Jam Jar (funny as a)
Definition: 1. Extremely funny indeed. 2. Strange, and therefore 'funny' in the sense of peculiar
Example Use: Gee whizz. When Sting (qv) came on Wogan with his wee Amazonian mate, you know, the one with a CD drawer instead of a mouth....funny as a pike in a jamjar.

Definition: Career choice favoured by most if not all List members
Example Use: You may been Out With Andy" til 5 but you were still sending work emails before nine this morning. I mean it's hardly journeyman

Definition: A planned night of booze and depravity for which it is difficult to obtain a pass and which would leave you in a worse state than an actual night out with Andy, if such a thing can be imagined. Characterised by the non-involvement of Andy, who for the purposes of this transaction is a 'beard'.
Example Use: I've told Helen that I'm going 'out with Andy' on Friday
column5: so I'm covered for whatever dire state I get home in"."

Definition: A collecion of young women draping themselves across a list member in the manner of the White Helmet Display team.
Example Use: See when we were in Westport a load of young gals draped themselves over Bailey like a White Helmet display troop.

Definition: Quantification of substantive error. Originated in the widely held but erroneous view that Boab had misattributed soul anthem 'Zoom' to The Commodores rather than Fat Larry's Band. Few realised that Boab was referring to the Commodores hit of the same name, available on almost any Commodores hits collection. Why, they were playing it in Smiths just the other day. Replaced earlier 'Proust/ Sartre farrago' (archaic) in common usage.
Example Use: This was a blunder of Fat Larry proportions.

Definition: A sordid act designed to make the recipient feel intellectually sated.
Example Use: Uhh... give me paper... give me paper... oh yeah... Brief History Of Time... oh yeah... more... more... harder... harder... gimme a harder book... oh yeah... yeah... Rough Guide To Classical Music... aaah... aaah... ... ... ooh... that was lovely.

Definition: A shortened fillum name used by hippies to refer to something useless. Co-incidentally the length of time taken to say the name and the amount of entertainment in both book and film are identical
Example Use: If dolphins were really that smart, one of them would go for Chris Martin.

Definition: Short retort given by Andy to indicate that the previous poster had made some excellent points that cannot be refuted, but which Andy feels he should protest about anyway, since it upsets his life-view.
Example Use: Eating pies and supping pints makes you fat? WALOB!

Definition: Burd (qv) who wrote the Namaste(qv) Blog (qv). Possibly an ex-colleague of Leigh's who may or may not be going out with Gil (qv)
Example Use: Jeez I hope that Namaste burd doesn't go off on her hols again,

Definition: Margarine For Men (abbrev). 1. Boab's wain, named after Terry Wogan advertised non-dairy spread. 2. Not butter.
Recondite practice much favoured by Canadians of Greek ethnicity.
Example Use: Edmonton is
column6: full of g@y cowboys sitting around 'eating pudding'""

Definition: Prefix meaning "the opposite of". Typically used by philosophical cnuts.
Example Use: The opposite of 'not' is 'not-not'. However
column5: the opposite of 'not-not'  is not 'not' but rather 'not-not-not.""

Definition: Prefix indicating anything favoured by fey, perpetual student types. Examples include alt.rock (of course), alt.country, alt.pub (drinking house favoured by such types).  Synonyms include ersatz-, faux-, pretend-.
Example Use: that's the sort of rubbish (probably Ramsay Music
column5: qv) you'd hear in one of your alt.pubs.""

Definition: See Morrissey
Example Use: http://www.mickhucknall.com/

Definition: Inordinately long post detailing the insignificant minutiae relating to activities surrounding a visit to a live musical performance.  Under no circumstances should  any mention be made of the actual band or performance. Incidental observations such as the bouncer's choice of footware, or the state of the tiling in the ladies' rest room should be discussed instead.
Example Use: Gig Review: Hairy Dirtbox at The Kaplinsky Stadium. Outside the train station I popped into Auntie Dora's sandwich shop. As I took my first bite from my Reuben (corned beef, sauerkraut and mustard on toasted rye) I noticed an attractive young lady in tartan docs crossing the street holding a Vote LibDem poster.... (continues on for another 15,000 words)

Definition: A term Kenneth Williams might have used to describe the leisure activities of gentlemen who prefer to "bowl from the pavilion end" (qv).   See also "Navigating a narrowboat through a set of locks"
Example Use: What do you think you would like to do on your visit to Brighton?" "Not sure

Definition: A gullible person. One who responds over-readily to a stimulus dulled through overuse (cf Psychocandy!) or notable only for its fatuity.
Example Use: In responding so readily to Boab's TiVo lure
column5: Andy was once more playing the tickled trout. ""

Definition: Diminutive scouse jock with remarkably resilient head.  Sometimes referred to as "Wee Zin".
Example Use: Leigh: "I dropped wee Zin on his head last night" (circa Zin aged 4 months old)

Term: The UK does not agree with your analysis
Definition: An opinion which is at best a blag, and at worst complete horseshit. Ramsay often encounters this when attempting to answer interview questions about his 3G (with stick men, dotted lines and cloud-shapes)
Originator: Someone who saw Ramsay's analysis of something telecoms-related
Example Use: I'm afraid the UK does not agree with your analysis. You haven't got the job. Want a taxi number ?

Definition: Guitarist in dismal forgettable 80's beat combo
Example Use: Our kid's playing in Glasgow in August. Anyone want to come? <eerie silence, tumbleweed drifts by>

Definition: Wayne Rooney
Example Use: What was Tattie Heid like last night eh? Couldnae hit a coo's erse with a banjo.

Definition: Generic and somewhat derogatory term for world music, particularly that originating in the former Soviet republics. Types include Uzbek and Kazakh. Superb(qv)
Example Use: Scott can't go to the boozer tonight because he's going to see a Ukrainian throat-warbelling concert in Glenrothes.

Term: What do you think you're doing?
Definition: Expression of concern / disdain directed towards members of the tradesman classes by RLP (qv) types. Pertains mainly to tea cup / marble hearth scenarios.
Example Use: What do you think you're doing?

Definition: The List's favourite book. Ever. Apart from Boab who singularly fails to show any interest in it whatsoever.
Example Use: I can't believe no-one's read A Million Little Pieces yet" (boab)

Definition: A mythical paradise, nay, a veritable Shangri-La, where the beer flows freely, the wimmin are abundant and bountiful, and John Bailey is worshipped as a s√©x-god.
Example Use: John Peel: This heaven's ok I suppose

Definition: A revolutionary form of homeworking characterised by lying in bed watching trash daytime tv with the sound turned down, with mobile and laptop somewhere within 50 yards. Practised by big fans of the horizontal genre.
Example Use: I was 'out with Andy' (qv) till 5.30 this morning so I'll be nerve-centering at best today.

Definition: Basic list hygiene. Failure to do so is a major cause of piles (of unread messages).
Example Use: Ooh. I'm having trouble going (on the list). Even when I do manage to go I'm only getting wee bits. This is fscking painful. If only I hadn't been so lax in stripping off the dingleberries.

Definition: M'Esclaffais. Francais pour LOL. Regardez PDLS.
def. Someone who is more worthy than worthy should allow
Example Use: That Nobo is just the latest rock star to think he can save the world

Definition: A 'humorous' misspelling of iPod. Only used by John B and Andy. Ignored as tedious by everyone else.
Example Use: Ramsay - does your iPlod have anything apart from Ramsay-Music (qv) on it ?  If not, I think I'm going to have to jump out of the window of this car in an attempt to commit ritual suicide

Definition: An expensive bagatelle. A gentleman's folly.
Example Use: Despite his early enthusiasm, Brian's purchase of a box-set of Fall Peel Sessions was turning out to be an error of almost eglu-esque proportions.

Definition: Someone who makes dinner, irons and doesn't know how to work a computer. Loobs (qv)
Example Use: Here comes the burd again. Wonder if she'll hang around this time.

Definition: 1. The pursuit of wisdom by intellectual means and moral self-discipline. 2. Long meaningless rambles about how many Ramones would have to leave or die before The Ramones would cease to be The Ramones.
Example Use: Boab: Andy's banging on about philosophy again. Psychocandy!

Definition: The superlative of Fat Larry" (qv). Originates with Bailey's swallowing - hook
Originator: line & sinker - of a piss-poor Independent April Fools gag on unlikely celebrity couples."
Example Use: JB
column5: This wasn't simply a Fat Larry moment. This was positively Condi-Carrott!

Definition: Cringingly "cute" salutation proffered by tedious globe-trotting french burds with delusions of blog (qv) adequacy. Sorry no pics (qv).
Example Use: Namaste! Yesterday I visited the holy temple of Murnaghan in deepest darkest Kaplinsky.  This is the only class one shrine in the northern hemisphere with its own integral falafel bar and shoe shine emporium.

Definition: Scott. Orig:  from ancient rap poet Gil Scott-Henderson
Example Use: WTF is Gil on about?

Definition: See Mick Hucknall
A sociable evening in a public house or similar establishment. Characterised by the non-appearance of Ramsay.
Example Use: List: Hey Ramsay
column5: are you showing up for next week's Ramsay Night Out?". Ramsay: "Not bloody likely.""

Definition: To adopt or assume the homosexualist lifestyle.  See also 'light in the loafers', 'friends of Dorothy', 'taking a narrowboat through the Dales', 'good with colours', 'puddle-jumping', 'lone striker' etc.
Example Use: Not that it's a problem to me
column5: but I suspect the new man in Marketing may 'bowl from the pavilion end'.""

Definition: Root node on Ramsay's iRiver (qv). Also: American musical genre associated with the line-dancing plague. Characterised by songs where the author's 'baby done gone left them' and probably 'didn't say a word'. Abbreviated to C&W.
Example Use: Should I characterise Billy Bob Wittgenstein as C&W - Americana or C&W - Americana - Roots - Arkansas.

Definition: Management w@nk term used to describe a disaster of biblical proportions.
Example Use: Control
column5: this is the Space Shuttle Challenger. Things are erm... sub-optima..." <BANG!>"

Definition: Legendary Norwegian disposable bubblegum pop/rock babes whose drummer has major crush on Brian.
Example Use: Although Marty raved enthusiastically about the new Hairy Dirtbox album, it rarely rose above proto Bronco Buster levels.

Definition: Delusionary state characterised by impression that tasty foreign wimmin find you devilishly attractive.
Example Use: As the Cloone ladies gaelic football team clambered all over Bailey he thought to himself "This is no Bronco Busters Syndrome - this is the real thing!"

Definition: A regular and routine occurrence. Indicates that subject matter of previously undreamt-of banality is being plumbed. Examples have included golf, chickens, motahs, anything to do with ecology, food or music of black origin (apparently) unless delivered by shouty geezers in baseball caps and hoodies and that.
Example Use: Andy's robust defence of Michael Jackson's childcare prowess was surely a new low for the list. The 17th new low since 10:30 this morning in fact.

Definition: Cavity or chamber used for the display of ornamental parachutists.
Descriptive of person or persons originating from Scotland.
Example Use: Just because you're Scotch is no reason not to support England.  "Is this where your Mary Queen of Scotchland lived?".

Definition: A recreational pursuit involing rolling coins while the tips of a lady's cowboy boots are inserted up your nostrils

1. Obscure thrash band that resurfaces from time to time to produce an EP of noise. 2. The foremost band to have their lead singer sectioned under the 1998 Mental Health Act and possibly the most influential band ever.
Example Use: The so-called Beatles" are certainly mildly influential

Definition: See Absolute Arse Head
Reactionary right-wing political party. Tory.
Example Use: I'm a self-satisfied rich arrogant tosser. So naturally I'll be voting Labour

Definition: Sexual favours. Esp. when offered by spouse to manual workers or tradesmen.
Example Use: When I got home I was suprised to see the pipe-work only half-finished and the plumber helping himself to the chocolate hob-nobs.

Definition: Unlistenable
Example Use: Cheap Trick obviously listened to the Beatles, The Raveonettes have heard the Mary Chain before, The Mars Volta were influenced by Rudimentary Peni

Definition: Whilst they do not actually exist, the Blind Alabamans are indicative of a new low (qv) in dismal 'world music'. Promoted by Gil (qv) as superb (qv)
Example Use: Scott - do you ever listen to anything other than Uzbek throat-warblers or the Blind Alabamans ? Why not crack out the Ramones for a change ? You'll feel better for it.

Definition: A famous showjumper who'll be forgotten in 12 months time
Example Use: I have no problem with show jumping per se. So long as we're talking hairy sweary Harvey Smith type stuff. But Ramsey's obsession with this Lucinda Williams nonsense beggars belief.

Definition: 1. The greatest record made in the last 20 years. 2. The most over-rated record made in the last 20 years.
Example Use: In order to fully appreciate Loveless you must play it at bone-shaking volume. It's gotta hurt. "Yeah - but it's still shit".

Definition: what no-one ever gets. Sometimes intentionally.
Uberc*nt. Superlative of c*ntish
Example Use: I am c*ntish. You are more c*ntish. He is Sting. O Sting
column6: SarahCarla,Semi-mythical List love goddess from the fabled land of Leitrim. What members will see when their points are claimed from the Dead Pool spreadsheet. Brian has a temple web-site.,John B,Well that Scarlett Johanssen's all very nice but not as good-looking as SarahCarla".

Definition: Bizarre 'handle' used by listmember Gil (qv). Presumed to be done so as to look mysterious and interesting but sadly we can all tell who it is anyway. See also 'cocopops', 'boy_mcgenius' etc. Strange
Example Use: Celticfeet2001:  You are all tossahs. (thinks: they'll never guess it's me)

Definition: Ocean Colour Scene (abbrev). Superlative of mediocre.
Example Use: I am mediocre (as IoJ standards demand). You are Stereophonics. They are OCS.

Definition: A band that Brian Harvey was in.
Example Use: I love that Brian (Ramsay)
